Package jeroquest.logic

Class Jeroquest

java.lang.Object
jeroquest.logic.Jeroquest
public class Jeroquest
extends java.lang.Object
Programming Methodology Practice. Jeroquest - An example of Object Oriented Programming. Class Jeroquest - Represents the game Jeroquest and allows to play it. For that it offers a method to create a new game and start the game.
Author:
Jorge Puente Peinador y Ramiro Varela Arias, Juan Luis Mateo

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static boolean blocked​(Game currentGame, Character c)
    Check if the character is blocked, that means if it cannot move in any direction: N, S, E, W (this method is static since it is given by the rules of the game)

      public Jeroquest()

  • Method Details

    • showGame

      public static void showGame()

    • toPlay

      public void toPlay()
      Simulate a Jeroquest game

    • newGame

      public void newGame​(int numHeroes, int numMonsters, int rows, int columns, int totalRounds)
      create a new game from its components
      Parameters:
      numHeroes - how many heroes
      numMonsters - how many monsters
      rows - height of the board
      columns - width of the board
      totalRounds - total number of rounds

    • opponentsLeft

      public boolean opponentsLeft()
      Check if there are characters alive of both sides
      Returns:
      true if there are at least one character alive for each side

    • blocked

      public static boolean blocked​(Game currentGame, Character c)
      Check if the character is blocked, that means if it cannot move in any direction: N, S, E, W (this method is static since it is given by the rules of the game)
      Parameters:
      currentGame - the current game
      c - character to check
      Returns:
      true if it cannot move in any direction

    • ranodmDirection

      public static Direction ranodmDirection()
      Generate a random position for movement
      Returns:
      a direction: North, South, East or West
